# Da Vinci DCode

## Write-up FR

Ce challenge introduit à la cryptographie avec une suite de chiffrement binaire, hexadécimal, base64 et Vigenère. 

À partir de `verySecretMessage.bin`, on extrait le code binaire :

```

```

[CyberChef]: https://gchq.github.io/CyberChef/
[DCode]: https://www.dcode.fr/chiffre-vigenere

Avec [CyberChef], on peut alors décoder le message pour obtenir :

```
You need to find Robert Langdon.
Jacques Saunière was the leader of the Priory of Sion. Watch out for Opus Dei on your tail! 


```

De même, on décode la deuxième partie du message (qui est de l'hexadécimal) :

```
Jesus of Nazareth is said to have had a child with Mary Magdalene. What you think is an object is actually a person.

VGhlIEdyYWlsIGNhbiBiZSBmb3VuZCBhdCBSb3NzbHluIENoYXBlbCwgd2hlcmUgVmlnZW7ocmUgYXdhaXRzIHlvdS4gSGUgaXMgdGhlIGd1YXJkaWFuIG9mIGEgc2VjcmV0IG92ZXIgMjAwMCB5ZWFycyBvbGQuDQoNCkVmdSBmemFlZCBpZSEgWnllIGZ3Z3ggaXMgYXVjeWNqaHZye2NjZWc3MDlyNHBzZV8xNV90MDBsfQ==
```

De même, on décode la troisième partie du message (qui est du base64) :

```
The Grail can be found at Rosslyn Chapel, where Vigen貥 awaits you. He is the guardian of a secret over 2000 years old.

Efu fzaed ie! Zye fwgx is aucycjhvr{cceg709r4pse_15_t00l}
```

La dernière partie du message est un code de Vigenère. A l'aide de [DCode], on peut brutforce le message en sachant que le message contient le mot `Polycyber`. On peut aussi essayer un des mots du message précédent. Le code secret est `Graal`. On obtient alors :

```You found it! The flag is polycyber{cryp709r4phy_15_c00l}```

## Write-up EN

This challenge introduces cryptography with a sequence of binary, hexadecimal, base64 and Vigenère ciphers. 

From `verySecretMessage.bin`, we extract the binary code :

```

```

Using [CyberChef], we can then decode the message to obtain :

```
You need to find Robert Langdon.
Jacques Saunière was the leader of the Priory of Sion. Watch out for Opus Dei on your tail! 


```

Similarly, we decode the second part of the message (which is hexadecimal):

```
Jesus of Nazareth is said to have had a child with Mary Magdalene. What you think is an object is actually a person.

VGhlIEdyYWlsIGNhbiBiZSBmb3VuZCBhdCBSb3NzbHluIENoYXBlbCwgd2hlcmUgVmlnZW7ocmUgYXdhaXRzIHlvdS4gSGUgaXMgdGhlIGd1YXJkaWFuIG9mIGEgc2VjcmV0IG92ZXIgMjAwMCB5ZWFycyBvbGQuDQoNCkVmdSBmemFlZCBpZSEgWnllIGZ3Z3ggaXMgYXVjeWNqaHZye2NjZWc3MDlyNHBzZV8xNV90MDBsfQ==
```

Similarly, we decode the third part of the message (which is base64):

```
The Grail can be found at Rosslyn Chapel, where Vigen貥 awaits you. He is the guardian of a secret over 2000 years old.

Efu fzaed ie! Zye fwgx is aucycjhvr{cceg709r4pse_15_t00l}
```

The last part of the message is a Vigenère code. Using [DCode], we can bruteforce the message knowing that it contains the word `Polycyber`. We can also try one of the words in the previous message. The secret code is `Graal`. The result is:

```You found it! The flag is polycyber{cryp709r4phy_15_c00l}```

## Flag

`polycyber{cryp709r4phy_15_c00l}`
